title: Harold Boardman
data: Harold Boardman (12 June 1907 â€“ 1 August 1994) was a British Labour Party politician. Born in Bolton, Boardman moved to Derby in his youth.[1]  He worked as an official of the Union of Shop, Distributive and Allied Workers and was a member of Derby Town Council for 25 years. He was chairman of the Derby Co-operative Movement and of Derby Labour College. Boardman was Member of Parliament for Leigh from 1945 to 1979, preceding Lawrence Cunliffe.
